body.p: These components are used to define what monitore for each hosts.
To access to this menu, go on Plugins > Monitoring > Components
Elements to configure for each component check are:

ul.li: Command: define command definied on chapter configuration_pluginmonitoring_command.dita. This field is required except if you define this component as a remote check.
Template (for graphs generation): select a template for graph generation (RRDTOOL).
Check definition: define the definition check for this component (see chapter ).
Active checks: is this component is an active check (Shinken run the command)
Passive check: is this component is a passive check (remote host run the command and send event to Shinken only when change)
Check period: set period (it's GLPI calendar) to define when check is running (24x7, not week end....)

body.p: It's possible to define a remote check, remote server run itself command and return to Shinken the result). This is the fields to set for this:

ul.li: Utility used for remote check: choose system to use: byssh, nrpe or nsca.
Use arguments (Only for NRPE): if nrpe is choosen, it's possible to define the command to run, so defined here and not in nrpe.cfg on remote system. Active this is dangerous for security!
Alias command if required (Only for NRPE): set the command defined in nrpe.cfg on remote servers.
